medications.importance: Critical for preventing heart failure recurrence and reducing cardiovascular mortality
adherence_tips: Take medications at the same time each day
Use a pill organizer to track daily doses
Keep medications in a visible location
red_flags: Missed doses for more than 2 consecutive days
Rapid weight gain (>3 lbs in 24 hours)
medications.evidence: Beta-blockers and ACE inhibitors reduce readmission risk by 30-40% (AHA Guidelines 2023)

therapy.importance: Cardiac rehabilitation improves cardiovascular function and reduces 30-day readmissions by 25%
adherence_tips: Schedule exercise at the same time daily
therapy.evidence: Cardiac rehab programs reduce mortality by 26% (Cochrane Review 2021)

diet.importance: Low-sodium diet prevents fluid retention and reduces heart failure exacerbations
adherence_tips: Use herbs and spices instead of salt
diet.evidence: Sodium restriction reduces HF hospitalizations by 36% (JAMA 2020)

medications.importance: Prevents hyperglycemia complications including DKA, neuropathy, and organ damage
adherence_tips: Monitor blood sugar before taking medications
Rotate injection sites to prevent lipohypertrophy
Keep a medication log with blood sugar readings
medications.evidence: Medication adherence reduces HbA1c by 0.7-1.0% (Diabetes Care 2022)

therapy.importance: Regular physical activity improves insulin sensitivity and glucose control
adherence_tips: Aim for 150 minutes of moderate activity per week
Check blood sugar before and after exercise
Wear proper footwear to prevent injuries
red_flags: No physical activity for extended periods
therapy.evidence: Exercise reduces HbA1c by 0.6% and improves cardiovascular outcomes (ADA 2023)

diet.importance: Carbohydrate management is essential for blood glucose control
diet.evidence: Medical nutrition therapy reduces HbA1c by 1-2% (ADA Guidelines 2023)

medications.importance: Pain management and anticoagulation prevent complications after surgery
adherence_tips: Take pain medication before pain becomes severe
Taper medications as directed, do not stop abruptly
red_flags: Blood clot symptoms (leg pain, swelling, warmth)
medications.evidence: Anticoagulation adherence reduces DVT risk by 60% (Orthopedics 2021)

therapy.importance: Physical therapy prevents stiffness and promotes proper healing after orthopedic surgery
adherence_tips: Use ice after therapy sessions to reduce inflammation
Progress gradually, do not rush recovery
red_flags: Increased joint stiffness or reduced range of motion
Weight bearing before cleared by surgeon
therapy.evidence: PT adherence improves functional outcomes by 40% (JBJS 2020)

medications.importance: Inhaler medications and antibiotics prevent COPD exacerbations and pneumonia complications
adherence_tips: Use spacer device with inhalers for better delivery
Complete full antibiotic course even if feeling better
Track inhaler doses to know when to refill

therapy.importance: Pulmonary rehabilitation and breathing exercises improve lung function and quality of life
adherence_tips: Practice pursed-lip breathing throughout the day
red_flags: Anxiety or panic related to breathing

medications.importance: Medication adherence is the foundation of post-discharge recovery
adherence_tips: Understand what each medication is for
Never stop medications without consulting doctor
medications.evidence: Medication adherence reduces all-cause readmissions by 15% (BMJ 2021)

therapy.importance: Physical activity promotes healing and prevents deconditioning
therapy.evidence: Early mobilization reduces LOS and readmissions (Lancet 2020)

diet.importance: Proper nutrition supports healing and prevents complications
adherence_tips: Eat balanced meals with protein at each meal
Plan meals ahead to ensure healthy choices
diet.evidence: Nutritional support reduces complications by 20% (Clinical Nutrition 2022)
